metadata.title: CVE-2013-2111 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The IMAP functionality in Dovecot before 2.2.2 allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (infinite loop and CPU consumption) via invalidAPPEND parameters.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2111` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dovecot-core - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
dovecot-gssapi - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
dovecot-imapd - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
dovecot-ldap - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
dovecot-lmtpd - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
dovecot-managesieved - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
dovecot-mysql - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
dovecot-pgsql - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
dovecot-pop3d - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
dovecot-sieve - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
dovecot-solr - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
dovecot-sqlite - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
mail-stack-delivery - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dovecot package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2').
